page.title: 04The Trent and Mersey Canal
page.content: The Trent and Mersey Canal ran from {Middlewich}towards{Stoke-on-Trent} through Wheelock.{James Brindley}had already built some Canals but he had a dream of joining rivers and Canals together so they could run into the sea.The Trent and Mersey was first named{The Grand Trunk Canal}and was opened in 1777. Industries in other areas were pleased because the boats carried materials like brewing at Burton-on-Trent,salt at Middlewich and Sandbach and North Staffordshire coal mining.The business was taken over by the North Staffordshire Railway.It is still used to carry China but is mostly used for leisure.Some people sail in small cruisers,but most use converted Canal boats.People fish along side the Canal for carp and roach.
